com.sudoplay.axion.adapter

Class TagRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sudoplay.axion.adapter.TagRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class TagRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The TagRegistry class is responsible for maintaining relationships between integer ids, Tag classes, Tag value classes, TagAdapters, and TagConverters and providing lookup methods to access the data via its relationships.
    Author:
    Jason Taylor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
        TagRegistry()
      Creates a new, empty TagRegistry.
      protected TagRegistry(TagRegistry toCopy)
      Creates a new TagRegistry by copying the registry given.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TagRegistry

        public TagRegistry()
        Creates a new, empty TagRegistry.

      • TagRegistry

        protected TagRegistry(TagRegistry toCopy)
               throws AxionInstanceException
        Creates a new TagRegistry by copying the registry given.

        All TagAdapters and TagConverters are duplicated and assigned a reference to this registry.

        Parameters:
        toCopy -
        Throws:
        AxionInstanceException

    • Method Detail

      • registerBaseTagAdapter

        public void registerBaseTagAdapter(TagAdapter<Tag> newBaseTagAdapter)
                            throws AxionInstanceException
        Registers a TagAdapter as the base tag adapter. The base tag adapter is the entry point for reading and writing a tag hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        newBaseTagAdapter -
        Throws:
        AxionInstanceException

      • register

        public <T extends Tag,V> void register(int id,
                              java.lang.Class<T> tagClass,
                              java.lang.Class<V> type,
                              TagAdapter<T> adapter,
                              TagConverter<T,V> converter)
              throws AxionTagRegistrationException,
                     AxionInstanceException
        Registers a TagAdapter and TagConverter with an id, tag class, and value class. Tags must be registered to be recognized by the system.

        An exception is thrown if a duplicate id, tag class, or value class is registered.

        Parameters:
        id - the int id of the Tag
        tagClass - the class of the Tag
        type - the class of the value represented by the tag
        adapter - the TagAdapter for the Tag
        converter - the TagConverter for the Tag
        Throws:
        AxionTagRegistrationException
        AxionInstanceException

      • getBaseTagAdapter

        public TagAdapter<Tag> getBaseTagAdapter()
                                  throws AxionTagRegistrationException
        Returns the TagAdapter registered as the base tag adapter.

        If no base tag adapter has been registered, an exception is thrown.

        Returns:
        the TagAdapter registered as the base tag adapter
        Throws:
        AxionTagRegistrationException

      • getAdapterFor

        public <T extends Tag> TagAdapter<T> getAdapterFor(int id)
                                        throws AxionTagRegistrationException
        Returns the TagAdapter registered for the int id given.

        If no adapter is found, an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        id - the int id to get the TagAdapter for
        Returns:
        the TagAdapter registered for the int id given
        Throws:
        AxionTagRegistrationException

        If no adapter is found, an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the TagAdapter registered for the Tag class given
        Throws:
        AxionTagRegistrationException
